questions.question: 1. What is the mission of 'citacita'?
questions.answer:
The mission of 'citacita' is to assist women in Malaysia who have left their careers for family responsibilities and are seeking to re-enter the workforce. This group includes: 

1. Mothers with young children who need nearby nurseries and kindergartens 

2. Single mothers facing financial pressures who need flexible job pathways 

3. Women returning from career breaks who require digital up-skilling to meet the current job market demands. 

By providing assistance to this group of women, we also contribute to reducing gender and income inequalities, aligning with SDG 10: Reduced Inequalities.

questions.question: 2. What kind of job information can I find?
questions.answer:
Jobs are displayed in three sections:

1. By Industry – Explore different industries and understand the opportunities available.

2. Jobs in Industry – See specific roles within your chosen industry.

3. Job Details – Learn about the requirements, skills, and pathways for each role.

questions.question: 3. What is the job quiz and how does it work?
questions.answer: The job quiz is a multiple-choice tool that guides you step by step. It always suggests a job based on your choices, so you don't feel lost even if you're unsure about qualifications or skills.

questions.question: 4. Can I bookmark or save jobs for later?
questions.answer: Currently, jobs cannot be bookmarked. However, each job page highlights related quizzes and suggestions to help you find the best-fit role.

questions.question: 5. Where do these job descriptions come from?
questions.answer: These job descriptions come from MASCO 2020, prepared by the Ministry of Human Resources Malaysia. You can access it here: https://emasco.mohr.gov.my/

questions.question: 6. How does the map function work?
questions.answer: The map shows childcare centers, kindergartens, nurseries, and other supportive services near workplaces. Please note: the map is not saveable, but you can revisit it anytime to search again.

questions.question: 7. Is there AI for confidence and career readiness?
questions.answer: The platform provides AI-driven resume builders, interview coaching suggestions, and even role models' stories to inspire women re-entering the workforce. These tools are designed to boost confidence step by step.

questions.question: 8. What is the AI Resume Checker?
questions.answer: The Resume Checker reviews your uploaded resume and highlights strengths and areas for improvement. It checks for clarity, keywords that match job descriptions, and missing information. You'll receive practical suggestions to make your resume stronger and more competitive.

questions.question: 9. How does the AI Mock Interview tool help?
questions.answer: The Mock Interview simulates common interview questions based on your chosen job role. The AI analyses your responses, tone, and structure, then provides constructive feedback. This allows you to practice in a safe environment, gain confidence, and improve before facing real interviews.

questions.question: 10. What does the AI Chatbot do?
questions.answer: The AI Chatbot is your 24/7 guide for the website. You can ask it questions about navigating pages, finding job suggestions, using the quizzes, or accessing childcare maps. It's like having a friendly assistant to walk you through the site whenever you need help.

questions.question: 11. Are these AI tools safe and reliable?
questions.answer: Yes. We follow ethical AI practices to ensure your data remains private and secure. The AI tools are not meant to replace human guidance but to extend support—helping you feel confident, prepared, and empowered in your career journey.

grants.title: Career Comeback Programme & Individual Tax Benefits (TalentCorp)
items: Support Services: Workshops, career guidance, and employer connections;
Personal Tax Exemption: 12-month personal income tax exemption for eligible women, valid until 31 December 2027.

grants.title: Employer Tax Incentives for Hiring Women Returnees (Budget 2025)
grants.target: Employers hiring women returning to work.
items: Eligibility Period: 1 January 2025 to 31 December 2027;
Tax Benefit: Additional 50% tax deduction on remuneration paid for first 12 months of employment;
Coverage: Salaries and wages for qualifying female employees.

grants.title: Flexible Work Arrangement (FWA) Support & Incentives
grants.target: Employers implementing family-friendly work arrangements that support women's work-life balance and return to workforce.
items: Legal Framework: Employment Act 1955 (Amendment) 2022, Sections 60P and 60Q;
Government Support: KESUMA, JTKSM, and TalentCorp provide implementation guidelines;
Tax Benefits: 50% tax deduction on FWA capacity building and software expenses (capped at RM500,000), valid 2025-2027.

grants.title: Enhanced Family Care Support & Tax Relief
grants.target: Employees and employers supporting family care responsibilities.
items: For Employees:
a. Childcare Tax Relief: RM3,000 annual tax relief for childcare expenses (children ≤ 6 years);
b. Elderly Care Expansion: From 2025, tax exemption expanded to include elderly care allowances for parents/grandparents.
For Employers:
a. Allowance Deductions: Tax deductions for providing childcare/elderly care allowances to employees;
b. Caregiving Leave Incentive: 50% tax deduction for employers offering additional paid caregiving leave (up to 12 months), effective 2025-2027.

grants.title: Women's Empowerment Corporate Initiative
grants.target: Companies promoting gender equality and women's workplace advancement.
items: Programme: UN Women, LeadWomen, and TalentCorp Corporate Action Lab with 11 participating companies as inaugural cohort;
Focus: Family-friendly workplace development, women's retention and advancement;
Goal: Achieve 60% female labour participation rate;
Timeline: 2025 initiative under Malaysia's ASEAN Chair theme.

grants.title: MYFutureJobs Women initiative
grants.target: An initiative by MYFutureJobs focused on empowering women in the targeted group such as single mothers, housewives and woman who is taking a temporary break from their career and are ready to get back to work.
items: Programme:
a. Re-skilling & Up-skilling Programmes;
b. MYMidCareer40;
c. MYNextChampion;
d. Career Fairs;
e. Social Protection.

grants.title: MYFutureJobs Training and Job Placement
grants.target: Offers re-skilling and up-skilling programmes to address skill gaps, boost employability, and prevent long-term unemployment.
items: Programme:
a. MICROSOFT OFFICE COURSES (WORD,EXCEL &POWERPOINT);
b. CERTIFICATE IN DIGITAL MARKETING FOR IR 4.0 (ONLINE);
c. FACEBOOK MARKETING COURSES & SALES PAGE DEVELOPMENT;
d. CERTIFICATE IN PROJECT MANAGEMENT (CIPM);
e. DIGITAL MARKETING FOR SME TRAINING.

grants.title: TalentCorp For Professionals
grants.target: Opportunities for you in Malaysia, whether you're a Malaysian at home or abroad, an expatriate already living and working here, or a woman looking to come back to work.

grants.title: Employment Insurance System for Insured Persons (IP) Who Have Loss Their Jobs (LINDUNG KERJAYA)
grants.target: Provide income replacement for Insured Persons (IP) who have lost their jobs.

grants.title: Special Business Financing Scheme for Women (DanaNITA)
grants.target:
a. To enhance women's participation in entrepreneurial activities, empower existing women entrepreneurs and increase household income;
b. To provide special financing for Bumiputera women entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

grants.title: PERANTIS
grants.target: To support leadership in women through mentorship with a RM50,000 grant.

grants.title: iJPW
grants.target: List of Support by the Department of Women Empowerment Malaysia.

grants.title: Women in Business (BI WinBiz) -- Bank Islam
grants.target: Women in Business Financing Programme (WinBiz) is a financing product specially designed for Malaysian Women Entrepreneurs under the category of Small and Medium Enterprise (SMEs) to cater for their working capital and/or capital expenses.

grants.title: MADANI WANITA-i (BSN)
grants.target: BSN Micro-i Madani Wanita is a micro financing facility offered to women entrepreneurs for those intending to expand their businesses.

finalReport.promptTitle: You are an expert AI career coach and interview analyst. Your task is to provide a comprehensive evaluation of a candidate's mock interview performance.
finalReport.jobRole: The interview was for the role of
finalReport.instruction: Based on all the provided information, please generate a detailed, professional, and constructive feedback report. The report must be in the same language as the interview and should be structured with the following sections using Markdown formatting:
finalReport.instructionNoVoice: Based on the provided interview transcript, please generate a detailed, professional, and constructive feedback report. The report must be in the same language as the interview and should be structured with the following sections using Markdown formatting:
finalReport.strength1: **(Strength 1):** Detail a specific strength, referencing an answer from the transcript if possible.
finalReport.improvement1: **(Improvement 1):** Identify a specific area for improvement (e.g., STAR method usage, technical depth, conciseness). Provide a clear example from their answers and suggest how they could have responded better.
finalReport.improvement2: **(Improvement 2):** Based on the pronunciation and fluency data, comment on their communication clarity. If there are issues (e.g., low fluency score, pronunciation errors), offer actionable advice for improvement. If their speech is clear, acknowledge it as a strength.
finalReport.improvement2_noVoice: **(Improvement 2):** Comment on the clarity and structure of the candidate's written answers. Suggest improvements in conciseness, structure (e.g., using the STAR method), or professionalism in language.
finalReport.conclusionText: Conclude with final encouraging words and 1-2 key takeaway recommendations for the candidate to focus on before their real interview.

step1.title: Navigation Menu
step1.description: Access five main pages: Jobs for Me (find jobs by industry or take a job quiz), Map (find childcare facilities in Malaysian cities), AI Tools (access AI-powered career resources), Grants (discover funding opportunities), and FAQ (find answers to common questions).

step2.title: Language Switcher
step2.description: Switch between English, Chinese (简体中文), and Malay (Bahasa Melayu) languages to use the website in your preferred language.

step3.title: Scene Navigation Buttons
step3.description: Click these yellow arrow buttons to switch between different scenes, or simply scroll with your mouse wheel to navigate through the 6 scenarios.

step4.title: Scene Information Card
step4.description: This circular card displays unique information for each scene, describing different features and opportunities available on our platform.

step5.title: Action Button
step5.description: Click this button to navigate directly to the corresponding feature page for the current scene.

step6.title: Firefly Scene Indicators
step6.description: These firefly indicators represent 6 different scenes. Click any indicator circle to jump directly to that scene without needing to scroll or click navigation buttons repeatedly.

step7.title: Citabot AI Assistant
step7.description: Click this floating Citabot button to access AI Tools page where you can chat with our AI assistant for personalized career guidance and support.

step8.title: Tour Guide Button
step8.description: Click this button anytime to restart the tour and review all features. It's always here when you need a refresher!
